 Tjänsten tillhör vår Kommunikationsavdelning men du kommer även operativt stötta Insamlingsavdelningen och arbeta nära andra specialister inom till exempel innehållsproduktion, insamling, kampanjer och teknikutveckling.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter/ansvarsområden:**
* Systemutveckling – koordinera utvecklingsarbete med interna och externa arbetsgrupper, arbeta med uppdatering och optimering av digitala produkter.
* Tekniska utvecklingsinitiativ utifrån strategier, webbanalys, samhällets teknikutveckling och lagkrav
* Analys och rapportering av data samt sätta upp och följa nyckeltal
* Utgöra ett tekniskt stöd för webbansvarig på wwf.se (nya sidor, förbättringar, SEO, formulär mm). Samt bidra till att höja kompetensen internt kring dessa frågor
* Ansvara för utvalda naturvårdsprojekt som rör teknik runt exempelvis webbkameror och annan teknisk lösning på wwf.se
* Teknik- och systemansvarig för ett antal kommunikations- och insamlingsverktyg, där säkring av GDPR, lagkrav och hantering av betal- och signeringsmetoder ingår, samt att driva arbetet mot headless.
* Operativa uppdrag i kommunikations- och insamlingsprojekt
* Bevaka utvecklingen inom betalösningar- och signeringsmetoder


 Vi söker dig som är van av att jobba med digitala plattformar utifrån ett engagemangs- och konverteringsfokus, gärna med bakgrund inom e-handel. Kombination av teknik och innehåll. Du har erfarenhet av produktägarskap och systemansvar och har en god förståelse för utveckling tillsammans med externa samarbetspartners. För att du ska lyckas och trivas i rollen krävs att du är självgående och har mycket god förmåga att koordinera och prioritera utvecklingssatsningar samt stötta interna kollegor. Du har kunskap inom webbanalys och konverteringsoptimering och behärskar verktyg som Google Analytics/Matomo, Looker Studio och Google Tag Manager. Det är också värdefullt om du har erfarenhet av SEO liksom tillgänglig webb.
   

  

 Som person är du noggrann och strukturerad och har lätt för att samarbeta och bygga relationer såväl internt som externt. Du trivs med stort ansvar och har lätt att prioritera för att nå uppsatta mål.
   

  

**För att passa i rollen behöver du ha följande bakgrund:**
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta systematiskt och holistiskt med digital utveckling
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med komplexa tekniska lösningar med många och stora beroenden mellan olika system.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta proaktivt med lösningsförslag baserade på behov.
* Erfarenhet av att paketera och beställa Webb/IT leveranser av externa IT leverantörer (upphandling, offerter, projektupplägg, leveransgodkännande, kvalitetssäkring mm)
* Kompetens och erfarenhet av API-hantering, HTML och cookies (datasäkerhet)
* Goda kunskaper av användarcentrerad och sökordsoptimerade kampanjer samt goda kunskaper och erfarenheter att arbeta med innehåll i WordPress och med verktyg som Google Ads, A/B-testning mm
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift samt en bra känsla för text och bild
* Grundläggande tekniska kunskaper, förståelse för CRM och för flerkanalsstrategi.


**WWF erbjuder:**
 Medarbetarna är vår viktigaste resurs och vi strävar efter att bli en av Sveriges mest eftertraktade arbetsplatser. Därför är det viktigt för oss att fokusera på inkluderande arbetsmiljö med fokus på ökad mångfald, hälsa och friskvård, tillsammans med strategisk kompetensutveckling och spännande utvecklingsmöjligheter.
   

  

 Vi är en lärande organisation och fokuserar på att stötta och coacha våra medarbetare så att deras inre motivation och drivkraft kommer till sin rätt. Det gör vi genom exempelvis föreläsningar, tvärgrupper och forum utöver medarbetarens individuella kompetensutveckling.
   

  

 Vi tror att en ökad flexibilitet i arbetstidens förläggning är en viktig del i livspusslet och erbjuder därför alla medarbetare flextid, förkortad arbetstid eller möjlighet till 50% distansarbete. WWF Sveriges kontor finns i vackert belägna Ulriksdals Slott med vattnet alldeles utanför fönstren. Du kommer att få arbeta med kompetenta medarbetare i en stimulerande miljö. WWF tillämpar ett aktivitetsbaserat arbetssätt, är anslutet till kollektivavtal och följer ITP 1 planen.
   

  

 Vill du veta mer om WWF som arbetsplats? Läs vidare här: WWF som arbetsplats - WWF
   

  

**Omfattning:** 
 Heltid.
   

  

**Tillträde:** 
 Så snart som möjligt.
   

  

**Varaktighet:** 
 Tills vidare. Vi tillämpar sex månaders provanställning.
   

  

**Stationeringsort:** 
 Solna, Ulriksdals slott. Det finns också möjlighet till arbete på annan plats, exempelvis hemifrån, upp till 50 %.
   

  

**Kontakt:**
 Namn: Åsa Thulin
   

  

 Titel: Tillförordnad avdelningschef Kommunikation
   

  

 Epost: asa.thulin@wwf.se
   

  

**Ansökan:**
 Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt dock senast 2025-06-22. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag.
   

  

 Har du frågor om rekryteringsprocessen? Kontakta: Ecaterina Cavieres, People & Culture på WWF via växeln 08-624 74 00 eller på ecaterina.cavieres@wwf.se.
   

  

**Facklig representant**
 Namn: Unionen, Akademikerförbundet Facklig representant.
   

  

 Telefon: Växelnummer 08-624 74 00
   

  

*Världsnaturfonden WWF arbetar aktivt för att alla anställda ska ha samma möjligheter och rättigheter oavsett ålder, etnisk eller kulturell bakgrund, könsidentitet och könsuttryck, religion/tro, sexuell läggning eller funktionsförutsättning.*
 Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: IT-chef
description:
MediCarrier är Region Stockholms logistik- och transportföretag, och vårdens externa lager. Från 1 januari 2021 ansvarar MediCarrier även för regionens beredskapslager avseende kritisk skyddsutrustning och kritiska förbrukningsartiklar till hälso- och sjukvården. Vi är ett dynamiskt och växande bolag med ett viktigt samhällsuppdrag. Vi omsätter cirka 1,4 miljarder kronor, hanterar 9 000 orderrader per dag och gör 30 000 angöringar per månad.
   

  

 Nu rekryterar vi en IT-chef som vill fortsätta arbetet med att bygga en robust IT-verksamhet. Du är en trygg, närvarande och handlingskraftig ledare med hög kompetens inom IT. Du är en kommunikativ ledare som visar vägen, får saker att hända och leder genom att involvera och engagera.
   

  

 Rollen är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid med placering i Lunda/Spånga. Det finns möjlighet till delvist distansarbete och provanställning kan komma att tillämpas. Hos oss får du en nyckelroll i en samhällsviktig verksamhet som gör skillnad för vården och regionens invånare. Du rapporterar till VD.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 MediCarrier hanterar logistikflöden som ställer höga krav på robusta och tillförlitliga IT-system. Som IT-chef har du det övergripande ansvaret för att säkerställa en trygg och stabil IT-drift, samordna och vidareutveckla våra IT-tjänster samt erbjuda ett effektivt IT-stöd till hela organisationen. Du är en del av bolagets ledningsgrupp och rapporterar direkt till VD. Du ingår även i Region Stockholms olika nätverk för IT-chefer. I rollen leder du ett team på tio direktrapporterande medarbetare och arbetar både strategiskt och operativt för att driva verksamheten framåt.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter i huvudsak:**
 I rollen som IT-chef är du ledande, rådgivande och stödjande i MediCarriers digitala utveckling. Du har ett helhetsansvar för IT-staben, inklusive personal, budget och arbetsmiljö. Ditt uppdrag handlar både om att säkerställa en stabil och säker IT-drift och att arbeta strategiskt för att förstå, möta och utveckla organisationens samlade IT-behov. Genom ett nära samarbete med övriga delar av verksamheten bidrar du till att skapa hållbara, effektiva och verksamhetsnära IT-lösningar som möjliggör MediCarriers uppdrag.
   

  

 Arbetet inom IT-området inkluderar:
   

  

* - Leda IT-utvecklingen i nära samarbete med affärsområden och staber
* - Ansvara för leverantörsstyrning och säkerställa en strukturerad, framåtblickande dialog med externa samarbetspartners
* - Utveckla och förvalta den strategiska IT-planen i linje med verksamhetens behov och övergripande mål
* - Leda arbetet med systemarkitektur tillsammans med specialister och säkerställa en stabil och behovsanpassad systemförvaltning (exempelvis AOM, IMI, Warehouse, Opter)
* - Driva IT- och informationssäkerhetsfrågor


 Som chef inom MediCarrier behöver du vara en agerande ledare: du är en förebild; du visar vägen; du Involverar och engagerar; du levererar resultat.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Du har akademisk examen inom för rollen relevant område, samt aktuell arbetslivserfarenhet inom verksamhetsområdet. Du behöver också ha tidigare erfarenhet som IT-chef med personal, - arbetsmiljö -och budgetansvar. Det är meriterande med erfarenhet inom offentlig sektor. Kurser som ITIL, 3PL och agilt arbetssätt samt ledarskapsträning ses också som meriterande.
   

  

 Du har en stark kravställarkompetens och en sund affärsmässighet i samarbetet med externa leverantörer. Du är van vid att navigera i komplexa IT-miljöer med flera parallella system och leverantörsrelationer. Du har god förmåga att skapa struktur i en dynamisk vardag. Du har också dokumenterad erfarenhet av förändringsledning och drivs av att leda organisationer genom förändring med både strategisk höjd och operativ närvaro.
   

  

**Om verksamheten**
 MediCarrier AB är Region Stockholms logistik- och transportbolag. Bolaget distribuerar sjukvårds- och förbrukningsartiklar samt utför transporttjänster åt verksamheter inom Region Stockholm. Bolaget ansvarar även för Region Stockholms beredskapslager avseende kritisk skyddsutrustning och kritiska förbrukningsartiklar till hälso- och sjukvården. På MediCarrier i Lunda/Spånga arbetar omkring 200 medarbetare. MediCarrier omsätter cirka 1,5 miljarder kronor.
   

  

 Då MediCarrier är en del av Region Stockholm arbetar vi med värdeorden kompetens, pålitlighet samverkan och öppenhet. Dessa ord genomsyrar hela verksamheten.
   

  

 När du börjar hos oss får du ett genomtänkt introduktionsprogram för att snabbt komma in i rollen och förstå både din del och vår del i Region Stockholm. Vi erbjuder bland annat friskvårdsbidrag på 5 000 kr, löneväxling, företagsgym och möjlighet till distansarbete utifrån verksamhetens behov.
   

  

 Det här är ett uppdrag för dig som vill bidra med din kompetens där den verkligen gör skillnad.
   

  

 I den här rekryteringen samarbetar vi med Poolia.
   

  

 VI ser framemot din CV och ett personligt brev på svenska. Varmt välkommen med din ansökan. Vänligen observera att urval och intervjuer kommer att påbörjas i augusti, ansök genom att klicka på ansök på https://www.poolia.se.
   

  

 Poolia är ett registrerat rekryterings och bemanningsföretag, vi är auktoriserade av Kompetensföretagen och har kvalitetssäkrade processer och rutiner.
   

  

 Vi hoppas att du kontaktar Poolia för en vidare dialog om rollen. Välkommen!
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/4154 | Publicerat: 2025-06-20 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-08-17

title: Technical Analyst
company_industry: Insurance and Business Consulting and Services
description:
Mercer Marsh Benefits (MMB) is seeking a
 **Technical Analyst** 
 to join our
 **Global Benefits Management (GBM)** 
 team in Stockholm, Sweden. This is a hybrid working role with a requirement to work 3 days a week in the office.
   

  

 Global Benefits Management (GBM) allows multinational organizations to manage their insured employee benefits around the world more effectively. The Mercer Marsh Benefits (MMB) global GBM solution delivers everything clients need when it comes to local broking renewals, global co-ordination, technology, governance and consulting.
   

  

 If you are ready to be part of our journey to enhance workplaces and promote gender equality, we encourage you to apply!
   

  

**The role: Compensation Consulting Analyst Intern**
**We will count on you to:**
* Support the implementation and ongoing management of a portfolio of clients, ensuring alignment with internal and external parties.
* Ensure adherence to GBM Rules of the Road by local brokers and provide renewal directions while compiling project timelines.
* Maintain internal policy tracking and inventory platforms, and assist with the management of benefit platforms as needed.
* Partner with the Centre of Excellence for operational support and peer review tasks completed by the team.
* Manage delivery and materials for clients, presenting results during client meetings.


**What you need to have:**
* Exceptional organizational and coordination skills, with a strong analytical mindset and attention to detail.
* Proven ability to interact and drive priorities with senior stakeholders in a global context.
* Strong oral and written communication skills in English; fluency in Swedish is a plus.
* Proficiency in MS PowerPoint and Excel, with a commitment to quality and deadlines.
* Experience in client-facing roles, preferably within the Insurance or Employee Benefits sectors.


**What makes you stand out:**
* Previous experience in Global Benefits Management.
* Demonstrated ability to facilitate and solve problems for multiple stakeholders.
* Experience in process building, best practices, and efficiency projects.
* Strong teamwork skills combined with the ability to work independently with minimal supervision.


**Why join our team?**
* Opportunity to work with a global industry leader
* A collaborative and inclusive work environment that values diversity and promotes professional growth.


 #hybrid
   

  

 Mercer, a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC), is a global leader in helping clients realize their investment objectives, shape the future of work and enhance health and retirement outcomes for their people. Marsh McLennan is a global leader in risk, strategy and people, advising clients in 130 countries across four businesses: Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer and Oliver Wyman. With annual revenue of $24 billion and more than 90,000 colleagues, Marsh McLennan helps build the confidence to thrive through the power of perspective. For more information, visit mercer.com, or follow on LinkedIn and X.
   

  

 Marsh McLennan is committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible work environment. We aim to attract and retain the best people and embrace diversity of age, background, disability, ethnic origin, family duties, gender orientation or expression, marital status, nationality, parental status, personal or social status, political affiliation, race, religion and beliefs, sex/gender, sexual orientation or expression, skin color, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.
   

  

 Marsh McLennan is committed to hybrid work, which includes the flexibility of working remotely and the collaboration, connections and professional development benefits of working together in the office. All Marsh McLennan colleagues are expected to be in their local office or working onsite with clients at least three days per week. Office-based teams will identify at least one “anchor day” per week on which their full team will be together in person.
   

  

**R\_309424**

title: Internship – Sustainability in Business & Technology
description:
**Internship – Sustainability in Business & Technology** 




**Location: Stockholm** 




**Start Date: immediately** 




  





 Shape your Business-IT consulting career at an exceptional company Tata Consultancy Services (TCS).
 



 With more than 600,000 employees globally, we work with leading companies across industries helping them achieve their business goals and lead their digital transformation.
 



  





 TCS ranks amongst global top 3 technology consulting companies across multiple parameters: revenues, employees, market valuation and brand value.
 



 In Sweden we work with more than 50 companies who are leaders in their own space. With them we have long term and trustful relationships. TCS in Sweden and Nordics has been ranked as a Top Employer for 12 consecutive years that reflects the organization’s commitment to inclusive, empowered and entrepreneurial work culture.
 



 TCS follows the Tata Group philosophy of building sustainable businesses that are rooted in the community and committed to the environment. Corporate sustainability is part of our triple aim: people, planet and purpose. Our focus is on reducing carbon emissions, using renewable energy and focusing on a regenerative approach to business. How do we make this possible? By creating greater awareness of the environment in which we live through collaboration with our employees, suppliers, customers and society at large.
 



**We look forward to receiving your application for joining us on the exciting journey as we keep pushing the boundaries to create a safer, happier, environmentally rich and sustainable world around us.** 




  





  





**Your Internship Activities & Perspectives** 



* Support the Sustainability team in reviewing internal and external sustainability reports and prioritizing areas of engagement
* Study EU regulations and implication on Sweden & Nordics. Support compliance projects
* Analyze the regulatory framework and standards for sustainability in the country and understand their impact on the business
* Collaborate with the sustainability team on research and advisory services related to strategy, organization and processes for sustainable value chains, impact measurement, data analysis
* Understand SDG goals and related priorities for TCS Sweden
* Support coordination of Sustainability initiatives within TCS and its Customers
* Support the development of Sustainability focussed business and technology experiences in TCS Stockholm Pace Studio (i.e. TCS Innovation Hub)
* Prepare research papers and business presentations for Sales and Account teams
* Study industry-specific initiatives and assist team with market development
* Prepare research papers and business presentations
* Profile, Prepare and Participate in relevant Sustainability conferences on topics such as energy transition, circular economy, food and biodiversity, etc.



  





**Your Qualifications** 



* Enrollment in a Bachelor's or Master's degree program
* Experience in the field of sustainability gained through project work, internships or extracurricular activities
* Understanding of key sustainability issues in the country and in key industries
* Enthusiasm and Experience in digital technologies: GenAI, Low-Code programming technology to create simulations and use cases
* Strong proficiency in the use of Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word)
* Strong research and analytical skills
* Passion for personal and professional development related to the SDGs
* Organizational talent and coordination skills
* Openness to an international working environment
* Structured and independent way of working
* Business fluent in English and Swedish
* Availability for more than 6 months

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Join our Team**
**About The Opportunity**
 Step into a high-performing, innovative, and multicultural team based in Lindholmen. At Ericsson, you’ll work with data collected directly from our global operator customers, transforming it into actionable insights that drive product innovation, network optimization, and enhanced value creation for our clients. This role offers a unique chance to contribute to the future of telecommunications, working with cutting-edge big data technologies and shaping solutions that impact millions worldwide. If you’re eager to grow your expertise in data science and engineering within a collaborative and fast-paced environment, this is the role for you.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Work end-to-end as a big data engineer and data scientist, both independently and as a key member of our cross-functional team.
* Execute analytical experiments and develop innovative data-driven solutions to solve complex problems across Ericsson’s business domains.
* Provide subject matter expertise to understand business and technical requirements, implementing data engineering and data science techniques that enhance effectiveness and efficiency.
* Collaborate closely with stakeholders to communicate findings clearly and enable data-driven decision-making.
* Drive continuous improvement through innovation, knowledge sharing, and teamwork in a dynamic research-oriented environment.


**The Skills You Bring**
 Must-Have:
   

  

* MSc degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a closely related field.
* 1-2 years of experience in data science or data engineering.
* Proficiency in Excel, PowerPoint, PowerBI, SQL, and programming languages such as Python or Java.
* Ability to manage multiple projects and work effectively in a dynamic, research-focused team.
* Fluent in written and spoken English.


 Nice-to-Have:
   

  

* Knowledge of Cloud Services, AI and Generative AI, and S3 storage solutions.
* Experience with CI/CD pipelines and GitHub.
* Familiarity with structured and unstructured data management and modern data transformation methodologies.
* Telecom domain knowledge.


**Application**
 We look forward to your application with CV in English. We target 60% work-from-the office.
   

  

 Last day to apply is 23rd June 2025. Please note that we do not accept, proceed, or respond for applications sent via e-mail.
   

  

 If you have specific questions, you are welcome to contact Lovina Rebeiro, Sr. Talent Acquisition Partner at lovina.rebeiro@ericsson.com
   

  

**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Göteborg
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 768083

title: Senior Network Engineer
description:
**About Kambi**
*Kambi Group plc is a leading B2B provider of premium sports betting services to licensed gaming operators. Our services provide an end-to-end solution for operators wanting to launch a standalone Sportsbook or bolster their existing offering with an innovative sports betting product. From front-end user interface to customer intelligence, risk management and odds compiling, all built on our in-house developed software, we strive to deliver the ultimate service and solution to our partners.*
*Our vision is to create the world’s leading sports betting experiences, together with our partners.*
 Kambi's Engineering Operations team supports the infrastructure of the entire organisation and ensures a stable environment, so that Kambi’s business can deliver twenty-four seven, year-round. We are dedicated to agile operations, believe dev-ops and automation is a great way of achieving that and use agile methodologies to support our efforts along the road.
   

  

 As a part of the network team you will be responsible for Kambi’s network infrastructure on a global scale, there will be plenty of problem solving and room to learn. To fit our team, we believe you should thrive in a fast-paced environment where everyone is free to speak their mind and a good solution is prioritised over prestige.
   

  

 This is what you will do:
   

  

  

* Design, build and maintain the Kambi global network
* Create and improve the automation that our environment relies on
* Deliver reliable, scalable and highly available services
* Support other stakeholders such as NOC, internal teams and our partners
* Be operationally responsible for our infrastructure, including taking part in on-call rotation


 You'd like to work with:
   

  

  

* Networking concepts such as dynamic routing, CLOS-networking, site-to-site VPNs and security
* Configuration management (Puppet, Ansible)
* Scripting (Python, Bash, or any other programming language)
* Load balancing
* Network infrastructure on a global scale
* An Agile framework


 You can relate yourself to this if you:
   

  

  

* Think code and automation is the right way to evolve infrastructure
* Enjoy working in a close-knit, supportive team while also having great freedom in how you work.


 If you're eager to join a collaborative, supportive, and agile Infrastructure team based in central Stockholm, we'd love to hear from you. Please apply with your CV in English.
   

  

 #wearekambi
   

  

***Kambi's ongoing commitment to Diversity and Inclusion in the workplace***
*If you require any reasonable adjustment during the recruitment process, please notify your recruiter, who will assist you however they can. Diversity and inclusion is at the heart of who we are and who we aim to be. While we are proud of the positive and inclusive company culture we have created, we know we can do so much more. Kambi constantly evolves its Diversity and Inclusion strategy to ensure it becomes an even more inclusive and positive place to work, with the core management team reaffirming its commitment to delivering on employee feedback.*
***Creating an inclusive environment***
*We believe Kambi's greatest strength is the collective talent of our employees. Kambi is committed to ensuring we create an inclusive work environment where everyone can feel valued, thrive and achieve their potential, regardless of who they are or what their background is. We know that it is only by having a balance of different voices, values and opinions that Kambi is able to be the market leader it is today.*
*#wearekambi*

title: SMB Sales Specialist
description:
**Company Description**
  

 Devoteam is a leading technology partner to Google Cloud, AWS, and Microsoft across EMEA. With 20+ years of successful Google Cloud implementations and a team of certified experts, we drive digital transformation across various industries.
   

  

 At Devoteam, we champion a revolutionary "New Way of Work" that prioritises flexibility, personal growth, and joint success.
   

  

  
   

  

  

**Job Description**
  

 Drive Digital Transformation: Become a Mid-Market Cloud Advisor
   

* As a Cloud Advisor for Google Cloud and other cloud technologies at Devoteam, you will play a crucial role in expanding our footprint across the Nordics and DACH. You will be responsible for:
* Hunting for New Business: Identify and acquire new customers with a focus on medium-sized businesses, generating leads and building strong relationships with key decision-makers.
* Driving Revenue Growth: Develop and execute sales strategies to achieve ambitious targets, exceeding customer expectations and contributing to Devoteam's continued success with hyperscalers and ISVs.
* Mastering the Sales Cycle: Own the entire sales process, from initial contact and needs analysis to proposal development, negotiation, and closing deals.
* Building Long-Term Partnerships: Cultivate strong relationships with existing clients, identifying opportunities to expand our services and ensure their ongoing success in all areas of their technology procurement.


 Staying Ahead of the Curve: Maintain a deep understanding of the evolving Cloud ecosystem, including new products, services, and market trends.
   

  

  
   

  

 Success Stories:
   

  

*"Joining Devoteam in the Nordics has been a transformative experience. The support from the local tech teams and the clear growth path have enabled me to consistently exceed my sales targets."
   

  

 — Aliha Mahmood, Junior Sales, Sweden*
*"Transitioning from Google to Devoteam has been a remarkable experience. The collaborative culture and unwavering commitment to innovation at Devoteam have empowered me to utilize my Google Cloud expertise to its fullest potential. Working with cutting-edge Google Cloud solutions here has significantly advanced my career and allowed me to deliver exceptional value to our clients."
   

  

 — Thomas Brunn, Sales Executive, Norway*
 Territory
   

* You'll be working with startups and mid-market corporations across the Nordic or the DACH region, primarily digital natives.


  

  

**Qualifications**
* Proven Hunter: Demonstrated success in acquiring new customers and closing deals in the IT project business, with a focus on hyperscaler technologies.
* Solution-Oriented Mindset: Ability to understand client challenges and translate them into effective Cloud solutions.
* Strong Communication & Presentation Skills: Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively articulate the value proposition of Cloud to C-level executives.
* Relationship Builder: A natural networker who can build rapport and establish trust with clients and internal stakeholders.
* Results-Driven: Highly motivated and results-oriented, with a strong work ethic and a commitment to exceeding expectations.
* Languages: Excellent written and spoken English skills are essential. Fluency in a Nordic language is a plus. In DACH fluent German is a requirement.


        
   

  

  

**Additional Information**
  

 Devoteam is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued and respected. We encourage applications from individuals with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
   

  

  

  

 Benefits:
   

* Flexible Work Arrangements: Enjoy a hybrid work model with the freedom to choose your working hours and location.
* Career Development: Access to the Devoteam Academy for certified training and language courses, supporting your professional growth.
* International Opportunities: Explore potential career opportunities within our global network.
* Vibrant Culture: Be part of a dynamic and supportive team with regular social events and team-building activities.

title: Product Owner Infrastructure Operations - Epiroc IT
description:
The Infrastructure unit at Epiroc IT, is responsible for the global planning and delivery of hosting environments (cloud and on-prem), connectivity (WAN, LAN, cloud) and desktop environments for the modern workplace. We operate the IT environment for the global Epiroc and we have users in 150 countries.
   

  

**Join our team**
 With us you will get a work environment where you are invited to a great team, eager to embrace your unique blend of experience, competence and skill. We look forward to your creative ideas for how we can continue to evolve our unit, to even better serve the Epiroc business going forward. If you enjoy an international atmosphere, has interest in digital IT development and want to take part in driving our company vision to develop towards a sustainable mining industry for people and nature, you are likely to thrive with us!
   

  

**Your mission**
 We seek a person with a strong competence to analyze and structure operations. You understand what is being operated and you see the opportunities for improvement in how we do things. You will work with many stakeholders, and you need to be comfortable and skilled to work virtually across organizations and teams. We strive for continuous improvement and this role will be expected to work with measurement and KPIs. We are looking for you who are interested in being an important person in our development journey within operations. We are an international organization, and the corporate language is English.
   

  

 Main Responsibilities:
   

  

* Participate in stating the vision for our operational work.
* Lead the work towards common, cross-functional Infrastructure operations.
* Identify suitable measurements and KPIs leading us towards our target vison
* Participate in planning for the next steps in the evolution of the IT operations beyond the Infrastructure unit.
* Define cross-functional processes and ways of working within
* Work with continuous improvements to secure operational excellence


**Your profile**
 You have at least 5 years of experience from leading teams, projects or organizations in an IT-environment or technical development environment. You lead by listening, analyzing and driving. To accomplish results, your communication skills, your ability to organize and structure are key attributes in your skillset. You thrive from running several activities in parallel having good use of your strong stakeholder management skills.
   

  

 You strive for proactive ways of working as the general rule, with a good understanding of the reactive nature of operations work. You have experience from working in complex, cross-functional, local and global environments and you are creative in finding solutions to the variety of problems you will encounter. Our corporate language is English, and you are expected to work fluently in English in written and in speaking.
   

  

 As a person one of your main motivation factors is to accomplish results. You have perseverance and ability to take projects from start to finish, also when encountering obstacles or delays. You have a positive attitude and with your collaborative mindset you have the ability to get people to work efficiently towards common goals. You see feedback given and received as a useful tool to personal growth. You have interest and basic understanding for the technical IT Infrastructure landscape and willingness to learn what you do not have previous experience from.
   

  

 Safety first is a fundamental value for Epiroc, as a Product Owner it is important that this value resonates with you. In addition, you need:
   

  

* Documented experience from working in Network Operation Center (NOC) or equivalent.
* Experience of managing cost and budget
* Experience of and good ability to define and establish processes and work routines
* Experience from telecom operations is a plus
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent working experience
* Knowledge of ITIL is a preferred competence.


**Location and travel**
 This position is located in Stockholm or Örebro, Sweden. Occasional travel is required.
   

  

**Life at Epiroc**
 By joining our team, you can expect an atmosphere of creativity, innovation, and workplace diversity. You will be a part of a group of skilled and helpful colleagues who live by our core values: Collaboration, Commitment, and Innovation. We work in a global environment with over 113 different nationalities!
   

  

 In addition to the fact that we have a culture that is characterized by development combined with having a good balance between work and leisure, there are some things that makes us a little extra proud to work at Epiroc:
   

  

* Global career opportunities
* Epiroc University, for your own competence development
* Community involvement
* Benefits package, which amongst other things include flexible working hours and bonus.


**A hybrid workplace**
 Life at Epiroc can include the possibility for a hybrid workplace. It is a way of working that offers flexibility and participation allowing for a better balance between work and private life, which also promotes well-being. The hybrid workplace is an opportunity if work allows, based on your role, responsibilities, and individual conditions.
   

  

**Application and contact information**
 We encourage you to submit your application through our online career site as soon as possible, but no later than 29th of June 2025.
   

  

 We are committed to a thorough recruitment process, including interviews, reference checks and assessments. To ensure a safe working environment, we conduct identity checks and drug and alcohol screening. Our process is designed to be fair and inclusive; you can expect transparent communication and a balanced evaluation of your skills and experience.
   

  

 For questions about the position, please contact:
   

  

 Hiring Manager, Maria Jacobsson, maria.jacobsson@epiroc.com
   

  

 Recruitment specialist, Maria Tedsjö, maria.tedsjo@external.epiroc.com
   

  

**It all starts with people.** 
 The world needs metals and minerals for the energy transition and our cities and infrastructure must be developed to serve a growing population. To succeed, we need to speed up the shift towards more sustainable mining and construction industries. We at Epiroc accelerate this transformation, together with customers and business partners in more than 150 countries, by developing and providing innovative and safe equipment, digital solutions, and aftermarket support.
   

  

 All new thinkers are welcome. We are looking for those who want to develop, grow, and dare to think new. In Epiroc we attract, develop, and retain diverse talent valuing authenticity and unique perspectives, driving our spirit of innovation. We foster an inclusive culture where diversity isn't just a goal but a part of our values and way of working. This is how we do business for a sustainable future.  Learn more at www.epiroc.com

title: Customer Success Representative Sweden
description:
We’re a cutting-edge tech-enabled bank on a mission to revolutionize financing for small businesses across 7 markets in northern Europe. Our innovative solutions aim to simplify access to financing and enable growth for small businesses. As we scale, we are now looking for a Swedish speaking Customer Success Representative to be part of our journey to transform the financial landscape for entrepreneurs.
   

  

**The role**
 The role of Customer Success Representative involves supporting our Swedish customers via all of our inbound contact channels, phone, chat and email. You will resolve our customers errands which will be broad and varied, it can be anything from technical support regarding our Qred Visa card, questions about an ongoing loan application or help regarding invoices. You will take full ownership of the customer's errands and drive customer satisfaction through excellent customer service. You will be exposed to many parts of our business, giving you insights into both our Underwriting and Collections processes. In this role you will collaborate with colleagues in the team as well as other stakeholders and departments to drive errand resolution. We have grown the Swedish Customer Success team immensely in the past year, and also received our banking license at the end of last year. Therefore, you will also have an impact on new routines and ways of working both internally and on how we operate towards our customers.
   

  

 In this role, you will be a part of a large and diverse team of 19 people that houses Underwriters, Customer Success, and Collection Agents among others. This role reports to one of two Team Leads.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Manage inbound customer errands, via phone, chat, email.
* Take full ownership of the resolution and the customer facing contact.
* Collaborate with colleagues both within and outside the team to drive improvements.


**Qualifications**
* Experience in customer service, preferably via phone and email
* Basic knowledge of financial products
* Proven capabilities in high customer satisfaction
* Strong sense of ownership & detail orientation
* Curiosity and a will to constantly want to improve
* Experience from previous fintech and/or fast growing company is a plus
* Fluency in Swedish, both written and spoken
* Proficient in English, as it's our primary business language


**One last thing - if you’re about to send in your application**
 This is a full-time, permanent position based in Stockholm with working hours Monday-Friday 8:30-17:30. Don’t wait to send in your application, we are reviewing applications on a rolling basis. While the start date is flexible, the right candidate can join us immediately.
   

  

*Qred celebrates diversity and does not discriminate based on ethnicity, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law.*
 Qred is an international FinTech scale-up that specializes in digital financing solutions for small businesses, with operations in the Nordics, Benelux, Germany and Brazil. We are passionate about helping small businesses thrive and grow, by providing them with business loans and credit cards. Right now we’re in an exciting phase of our journey that focuses on growth through smart product development and technology fueled by international expansion.

title: Supply Chain Process Lead
company_industry: Nanotechnology Research and Motor Vehicle Manufacturing
description:
**Tata consultancy Services** 
 is an IT services, consulting and business solutions organization that has been partnering with many of the world’s largest businesses for the past 50 years. We believe innovation and collective knowledge can transform all our futures with greater purpose. We help companies across industries achieve their strategic goals and lead their digital transformation programs. With 600,000 experts globally and 18,000+ consultants working for leading Nordic Customers, we have a strong sense of purpose for the ecosystem around us – our employees, partners, customers and society.
 



  





 We are happy to invite applications for exciting internship opportunities at TCS. The internship allows you to gain unique and real-life perspectives in solving challenges for TCS and its Customers.
 



  





**Role: Supply Chain Process Lead** 




**Experience (Years): 15+ Years** 




**Language requirement: Swedish & English** 




  





**Must-Have:** 




  





 • Business Process Lead with Strong process knowledge and experience in planning & conducting process workshops and do FIT/GAP analysis in Supply Chain
 



 • Minimum of 15+ years of experience in SAP Retail – Supply chain logistics processes (Procure to Pay, Order to cash for both retail and eCommerce flows)
 



 • S/4 HANA Implementation experience is required
 



 • Hand-On with Process modelling tools Signavio preferred, other process modelling tools
 



 • Experience on
 



 • Represent in Process Board & Solution Design authority board on critical Process GAPs / Architecture solution review and decision documentation.
 



 • Ensure Fit to Standard and govern clean core principles with technical architects
 



 • Business process design documentation and coordinate with Process owners for review & ensure Sign-off
 



 • Strong Knowledge on Procure to Pay & Order to cash processes – Inventory management, Handling Units management, Inbound & Outbound delivery, advanced ATP in S/4, Goods receipt & Goods issue processes, Standard EDI Integrations, Cross Dock and Flow through merchandise processes are required
 



 • Knowledge on integrated processes with replenishment and allocation solutions, SAP EWM & 3rd Party WMS systems Integrations, Transport Management Integrations
 



 • Global retailer with eCommerce presence, knowledge of eCommerce sales flow with ATP reservations & omni channel availability solution is required
 



 • Experience / Capability knowledge on SAP EWM and any Transport Solutions & GTS trade services process exposure is preferred
 



 • Work with Business and Change management lead to draw out Change Impacts list
 



 • Understanding of LTMC and Data Migration capabilities to coordinate with data management team
 



 • Understanding of role-based process design and Fiori role design coordination with Roles & Authorization team is required
 



 • Hands on experience on Configuration in system is an advantage
 



 • Functional design ownership on solution fitment meets process design and business requirement
 



 • Good communication skills, problem solving mindset and cross functional coordination skills required
 



  





**Good to have:** 




  





 • Strong implementation Experience in SAP S/4 SCM.
 



 • Knowledge in Retail business
 



  





**Responsibility of / Expectations from the Role** 




  





 1)Should be able to analyze the critical issue and resolve in time
 



 2)Willingness to accept development challenges and work towards resolving them
 



 3)Should be a good team player and should be able to lead the team
 



 4)Should be willing to work in shifts
 



 5)Should be focused in on-time delivery
 



  





**We look forward to receiving your application via r.naveen2@tcs.com** 




  





**Privacy Note:** 




**https://ibegin.tcs.com/iBegin/privacy-notice**

title: Product Lead, Ads
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 We are looking for a Product Lead to join our AdTech team. This team is helping merchants and brands thrive on Wolt, and you could play a key role in making it happen.
   

  

 What does this mean in practice? Merchants and brands partner with Wolt to effectively reach local consumers, and advertising amplifies this capability. Whether it's a new merchant eager to quickly showcase their offerings to a wide audience, an existing merchant seeking sales growth, or a brand looking to raise product awareness, promote deals, and increase market share — our mission is to assist them in achieving their objectives while ensuring a great user experience.
   

  

 As a Product Lead, you will work with a cross-functional team of incredibly talented engineering, design, product and analytics humans in a high visibility role. You will be responsible for setting your team's vision, strategy and roadmap. This also involves leading multiple projects and cross-team product initiatives across the entire product lifecycle, partnering with business and operations stakeholders as well as understanding our customers better than anyone.
   

  

 📍This role can be based in one of our tech hubs in Helsinki, Berlin, or Stockholm
   

  

 Our humble expectations
   

  

 You could come to this role from a multitude of different backgrounds, but ideally, you have
   

  

* Proven experience as a Product Lead / Product Manager with experience from the B2B and/or Adtech and Martech space - you know what it takes to develop great business products
* Experience in leading products from concept to launch, setting the product vision, strategy, roadmap and tracking results.
* Expertise in working with and coaching cross-functional teams including business, design, data experts and engineers.
* Desire to be in a high-ownership role. You need to be comfortable with both getting your hands dirty as well as driving cross-team projects outside of your main domain.
* A mixture of data analysis skills, engineering understanding, design sensitivity, and business savviness with the go-getter attitude of a (humble) "could-be start-up CEO".
* Be confident in filling a high-visibility role that requires a strong sense of stakeholder management - the lights are on you.


 Next steps
   

  

 The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!
   

  

 The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Esports & Partnership Marketing Manager
description:
Logitech is the Sweet Spot for people who want their actions to have a positive global impact while having the flexibility to do it in their own way.
   

  

**The Role**
 Logitech G is looking for an Esports & Partnership Manager to be instrumental in the development and execution of our esports strategy. You will help make Logitech G the gear of choice for professional gamers, engage with esports athletes & fans worldwide and help develop content and programs for Europe. You will be part of a committed group of gamers and professionals who develop ideas and content to drive advocacy and adoption for Logitech G, one of the top brands in the gaming industry.
   

  

**Your Contribution**
 Be Yourself. Be Open. Stay Hungry and Humble. Collaborate. Challenge. Decide and just do. These are the behaviors you’ll need for success at Logitech.
   

  

 In this role you will:
   

  

* Drive the esports marketing strategy in the region by building a strong roster of teams / athletes and running marketing campaigns and activations to secure leadership positions for the Logitech G brand.
* Support local teams with developing and managing relationships with esports teams, athletes and communities within Europe. Manage major projects/teams directly with the support of local teams.
* Handle negotiations, develop frameworks and manage processes to enable smooth operations between Logitech G and the teams and athletes.
* Drive marketing campaigns and activations, product launches, brand and product content deployment across the entire marketing ecosystem targeting esports community and hardcore gamers.
* Build strategies to integrate professional athletes and organizations in Logitech G programs in close collaboration with the global PRO team.
* Execute global campaigns while developing locally-relevant strategies to effectively communicate and promote the esports story in the region. Ensure that all messaging and initiatives align with the company's values and mission.
* Be the face and voice of the brand towards gaming and esports communities and partners.
* Develop marketing and brand partnerships throughout Europe to increase brand awareness and boost conversions, in line with the company's objectives. Empower local teams to implement these strategies at every stage of the customer journey. Establish frameworks and oversee the execution of these initiatives.
* Guide and supervise local teams in planning and executing esports and gaming events in Europe.
* Communicating the Logitech G story and partnerships across various channels
* Coach & engage daily with local markets to help get Logitech G gear in the hands of top competitive players and upcoming rising stars in line with brand’s vision and strategy
* Monitor competitors’ activities and provide input (opportunities or risks)to respective internal teams


**Key Qualifications**
 For consideration, you must bring the following minimum skills and experiences to our team:
   

  

* Experience developing marketing programs from inception through execution
* 3+ years experience in esports or other sports marketing roles in game publishers or esports related companies
* Deep understanding of esports and how to build effective gaming communications
* Capable to work closely with cross-functional teams and brands within the regional structure
* The ability to analyze competitor strategies and innovate on best practices
* Strong networking, organizational and program management skills
* Experience working with and managing external agencies
* Ready to lead groups and ability to interact with partners
* Ability to use quantitative data and metrics to drive strategic decisions and marketing activities
* Self-motivated, passionate and high energy level
* Strong C-level presentation and negotiation skills
* Fluency in English is a must


 Across Logitech we empower collaboration and foster play. We help teams collaborate/learn from anywhere, without compromising on productivity or continuity so it should be no surprise that most of our jobs are open to work from home from most locations. Our hybrid work model allows some employees to work remotely while others work on-premises. Within this structure, you may have teams or departments split between working remotely and working in-house.
   

  

 Logitech is an amazing place to work because it is full of authentic people who are inclusive by nature as well as by design. Being a global company, we value our diversity and celebrate all our differences. Don’t meet every single requirement? Not a problem. If you feel you are the right candidate for the opportunity, we strongly recommend that you apply. We want to meet you!
   

  

 We offer comprehensive and competitive benefits packages and working environments that are designed to be flexible and help you to care for yourself and your loved ones, now and in the future. We believe that good health means more than getting medical care when you need it. Logitech supports a culture that encourages individuals to achieve good physical, financial, emotional, intellectual and social wellbeing so we all can create, achieve and enjoy more and support our families. We can’t wait to tell you more about them being that there are too many to list here and they vary based on location.
   

  

 All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, age, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.
   

  

 If you require an accommodation to complete any part of the application process, are limited in the ability, are unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact us toll free at +1-510-713-4866 for assistance and we will get back to you as soon as possible.

title: IT-chef till MediCarrier
description:
IT-chef
   

  

 IT-chef till MediCarrier
   

  

 MediCarrier är Region Stockholms logistik- och transportbolag med ett samhällsviktigt uppdrag. De levererar pålitlig och effektiv varuförsörjning till vården i hela regionen, utifrån vårdens behov och ägardirektiv.
   

  

 Nu rekryterar MediCarrier en IT-chef som vill fortsätta arbetet med att bygga en robust IT-verksamhet. Du är en trygg, närvarande och handlingskraftig ledare med hög kompetens inom IT. Du är en kommunikativ ledare som visar vägen, får saker att hända och leder genom att involvera och engagera.
   

  

 Rollen är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid med placering i Lunda/Spånga. Det finns möjlighet till delvist distansarbete och provanställning kan komma att tillämpas. Här får du en nyckelroll i en samhällsviktig verksamhet som gör skillnad för vården och regionens invånare. Du rapporterar till VD.
   

  

 Vänligen observera att urval och intervjuer kommer att påbörjas i augusti, välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Om tjänsten
   

  

 MediCarrier hanterar logistikflöden som ställer höga krav på robusta och tillförlitliga IT-system. Som IT-chef har du det övergripande ansvaret för att säkerställa en trygg och stabil IT-drift, samordna och vidareutveckla våra IT-tjänster samt erbjuda ett effektivt IT-stöd till hela organisationen. Du är en del av bolagets ledningsgrupp och rapporterar direkt till VD. I rollen leder du ett team på tio direktrapporterande medarbetare och arbetar både strategiskt och operativt för att driva verksamheten framåt.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter i huvudsak
   

  

 I rollen som IT-chef är du en ledande, rådgivande och stödjande i MediCarriers digitala utveckling. Du har ett helhetsansvar för IT-staben, inklusive personal, budget och arbetsmiljö. Ditt uppdrag handlar både om att säkerställa en stabil och säker IT-drift och att arbeta strategiskt för att förstå, möta och utveckla organisationens samlade IT-behov. Genom ett nära samarbete med övriga delar av verksamheten bidrar du till att skapa hållbara, effektiva och verksamhetsnära IT-lösningar som möjliggör MediCarriers uppdrag.
   

  

**Arbetet Inom IT-området Inkluderar**
 – Leda IT-utvecklingen i nära samarbete med affärsområden och staber
   

  

 – Ansvara för leverantörsstyrning och säkerställa en strukturerad, framåtblickande dialog med externa samarbetspartners
   

  

 – Utveckla och förvalta den strategiska IT-planen i linje med verksamhetens behov och övergripande mål
   

  

 – Leda arbetet med systemarkitektur tillsammans med specialister och säkerställa en stabil och behovsanpassad systemförvaltning (exempelvis AOM, IMI, Warehouse, Opter)
   

  

 – Driva IT- och informationssäkerhetsfrågor
   

  

 Som chef inom MediCarrier behöver du vara en agerande ledare: du är en förebild; du visar vägen; du Involverar och engagerar; du levererar resultat.
   

  

 Vem är du?
   

  

 Du har akademisk examen inom för rollen relevant område, samt aktuell arbetslivserfarenhet inom verksamhetsområdet. Du behöver också ha tidigare erfarenhet som IT-chef med personal, – arbetsmiljö -och budgetansvar. Det är meriterande med erfarenhet inom offentlig sektor. Kurser som ITIL, 3PL, agilt arbetssätt och ledarskapsträning ses också som meriterande.
   

  

 Du har en stark kravställarkompetens och en sund affärsmässighet i samarbetet med externa leverantörer. Du är van vid att navigera i komplexa IT-miljöer med flera parallella system och leverantörsrelationer. Du har god förmåga att skapa struktur i en dynamisk vardag. Du har också dokumenterad erfarenhet av förändringsledning och drivs av att leda organisationer genom förändring med både strategisk höjd och operativ närvaro.
   

  

 Om verksamheten
   

  

 MediCarrier AB är Region Stockholms logistik- och transportbolag. Bolaget distribuerar sjukvårds- och förbrukningsartiklar samt utför transporttjänster åt verksamheter inom Region Stockholm. Bolaget ansvarar även för Region Stockholms beredskapslager avseende kritisk skyddsutrustning och kritiska förbrukningsartiklar till hälso- och sjukvården. På MediCarrier i Lunda/Spånga arbetar omkring 200 medarbetare. MediCarrier omsätter cirka 1,5 miljarder kronor.
   

  

 Då MediCarrier är en del av Region Stockholm arbetar vi med värdeorden kompetens, pålitlighet samverkan och öppenhet. Dessa ord genomsyrar hela verksamheten.
   

  

 När du börjar hos oss får du ett genomtänkt introduktionsprogram för att snabbt komma in i rollen och förstå både din del och vår del i Region Stockholm. Vi erbjuder bland annat friskvårdsbidrag på 5 000 kr, löneväxling, företagsgym och möjlighet till distansarbete utifrån verksamhetens behov.
   

  

 Det här är ett uppdrag för dig som vill bidra med din kompetens där den verkligen gör skillnad.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan. Vänligen observera att urval och intervjuer kommer att påbörjas i augusti, ansök genom att klicka på ansök på https://www.poolia.se.
   

  

 Poolia är ett registrerat rekryterings och bemanningsföretag, vi är auktoriserade av Kompetensföretagen och har kvalitetssäkrade processer och rutiner.

title: Change & System lead - för nytt systemstöd på Stim
description:
*Stim är en medlemsorganisation utan vinstintresse för över 100 000 anslutna musikskapare och förlag. Vi arbetar för en stark upphovsrätt och för att låtskrivare och kompositörer ska få betalt för sin musik. Tillsammans med våra medlemmar ger vi förutsättningar för skapande och återväxt i Sveriges musikliv.* 
 Musik har ett värde – för den som lyssnar, den som skapar och för Sverige och samhället i stort.
   

  

 Vill du bidra till att stärka musikskapares rättigheter genom att stärka våra digitala lösningar? Stim söker en Change & System lead för vår internationella verkdatabas - CUBE, det system som innehåller hela världens musikrepertoar.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Vi söker en engagerad och strukturerad
 **Change & System** 
 lead till Stim med fokus på vårt nya internationella verkregister
 **CUBE** 
 – ett centralt system för att hantera information om musikverk och rättighetshavare globalt. Systemet lanserades i januari 2025 och befinner sig just nu i en intensiv implementeringsfas.
   

  

 I den här rollen kommer du att spela en nyckelfunktion i att stödja organisationen i övergången till CUBE och de nya arbetssätt som systemet innebär. Fokus ligger på att skapa förutsättningar för en effektiv användning i verksamheten – snarare än att leda själva produktutvecklingen.
   

  

 Tjänsten är ny på Stim och du rapporterar direkt till vår
 **Operations Director** 
 . CUBE är centralt för att upprätthålla kvalitet inom Stims kärnprocesser (Anslutning, Verkanmälan, Matchning av verk, Verkuppdatering och Utbetalning). I denna roll leder du ett tvärfunktionellt projektteam med deltagare från olika delar av organisationen. Ditt huvudansvar är att stabilisera och optimera vårt arbete med CUBE i samarbete med vår internationella tjänsteleverantör ICE.
   

  

 Du har en tydlig ledarroll (utan personalansvar), där du ansvarar för prioriteringar, processutveckling, testning och regression (tillsammans med Test Manager) och kommunikation kopplat till CUBE.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga** 
**arbetsuppgifter och ansvar**
* Leda det tvärfunktionella CUBE-projektteamet och driva produktvision samt backlog.
* Säkerställa strukturerade processer för prioritering av buggar och utveckling av dessa hos vår leverantör.
* Förbereda och planera för acceptanstester och releaser.
* Koordinera Stims specifika anpassningar i CUBE – från kravställning till acceptanstest och driftsättning.
* Bygga strukturer för rapportering, etablering av KPI:er och uppföljning av dessa samt intern kunskapsspridning.
* Fungera som nyckelkontakt gentemot tjänsteleverantören ICE
* Delta i kravställning och uppföljning av verkdata, avräkningar och systemprestanda.


**Vi söker dig som:**
 Har erfarenhet av att leda förändringsarbete i komplexa, gärna internationella, miljöer där teknik och verksamhet möts. Du trivs i en drivande roll där du samordnar olika kompetenser, bygger strukturer och säkerställer att nya arbetssätt och system implementeras effektivt.
   

  

 Med din kommunikativa och relationsskapande förmåga bygger du broar mellan olika delar av organisationen – från tekniska specialister till verksamhetsrepresentanter. Du är lösningsorienterad, har stark analytisk förmåga och ett genuint engagemang för att skapa värde genom smarta digitala lösningar och hållbara arbetssätt.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du:**
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att leda förändringsarbete, systeminföranden eller processutveckling i tvärfunktionella team – gärna i en internationell kontext.
* Vana att arbeta nära både IT och verksamhet, med förståelse för kravställning, systemlogik och informationsflöden.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med komplexa system, gärna i datatunga miljöer.
* Förmåga att skapa struktur, driva processer och fatta välavvägda prioriteringsbeslut – utan formellt personalansvar.
* God kunskap i verktyg som Jira eller motsvarande system för ärendehantering/test/release.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
* En kombination av operativ handlingskraft och strategisk förmåga.


 Det är starkt meriterande om du också har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av samarbete med internationella IT-leverantörer.
* Kännedom om musikbranschen, upphovsrätt eller arbete med rättighetsdata


**Om Stim**
 Hos Stim får du möjlighet att arbeta i en organisation som stärker musikskapares förutsättningar att verka i branschen och som främjar musikalisk mångfald. Vi är stolta över vår inkluderande och engagerade arbetskultur, där vi värdesätter innovation och samarbete.
   

  

 Vi är 150 anställda som arbetar i nyrenoverade lokaler på Hornsgatan i Stockholm, där vi vigt ett helt våningsplan åt våra anslutna musikskapare i form av Stim Music Room. Här finns bland annat tre inspelningsstudior och en co-working-yta.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Låter det intressant? Tjänsten är en visstidsanställning på två år. Tillträde sker så snart som möjligt eller enligt överenskommelse. Välkommen in med din ansökan så snart som möjligt, urval sker löpande. Sista ansökningsdag är den 5 augusti, men eftersom urval sker löpande kan annonsen komma att stängas ned innan ansökningsperioden är slut om vi har ett bra kandidatunderlag.
   

  

 För ytterligare information om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Claudia Salazar, Operations Director via claudia.salazar@stim.se. Facklig kontaktperson för Unionen är Susan Roberts via susan.roberts@stim.se.

title: International Business Development & Sales Manager -Healthcare
description:
**About the Role** 




  





 LifeClean is expanding the international market presence of its chlorine dioxide-based disinfectant, NUGEN® HLD-CD, licensed at the European level by Arxada. The role will focus on developing commercial partnerships in both the Middle East and Asia simultaneously. The ideal candidate brings extensive experience in healthcare-related sales and business development, particularly within medtech or hospital-focused environments.
 



  





 While the preferred location for the position is Stockholm, in order to contribute to team and culture development, strong candidates based in other key regions will also be considered. The position involves regular travel within the focus regions.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 




  




* Build and expand a robust network of resellers and medical technology partners across the Middle East and Asia.
* Train resellers and healthcare staff on the effective use and benefits of LifeClean’s chlorine dioxide product.
* Initiate and manage relationships with procurement decision-makers in hospitals, clinics, and distribution organizations.
* Adjust commercial strategies in line with local healthcare regulations, procurement systems, and cultural dynamics.
* Collaborate cross-functionally with LifeClean’s regulatory, marketing, and communications teams to support product launches and brand visibility in new markets.



  





**Experience & Qualifications** 




  




* Proven experience in developing and scaling distributor and reseller networks across international markets.
* Background in selling medical devices, high-level disinfectants, or sterilization solutions.
* Strong knowledge of healthcare systems and procurement processes, particularly within the Middle East. Experience and contacts within Asian healthcare markets are equally relevant and highly valued.
* Experience with chlorine dioxide or similar disinfectant technologies is a significant advantage.
* Fluent in English; additional language skills such as Arabic, Persian, or French are considered beneficial.
* Strategic and commercially driven, with a pragmatic and entrepreneurial mindset.
* High level of cultural awareness and experience managing complex stakeholder landscapes across public and private healthcare settings.
* Excellent interpersonal skills and adaptability when delivering training and presentations in varied market contexts.



  





 Lifeclean is collaborating with Nigel Wright for this recruitment. For any questions about the role, please reach out to Amanda Vad.

title: Associate Payments Business Analyst – based in Luxembourg
description:
This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence. The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.
   

  

 The
 **EIB** 
 , the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Finance Directorate (FI), Planning and Settlement of Operations Department (PRO), Contracts and Business Solutions Division (CBS), Business Digitalisation and Support Unit (BuDis) at its headquarters in Luxembourg, an
 **Associate Payments** 
**Business Analyst\*.**
 This is a full-time position at grade 4 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.
   

  

* internal benchmark Associate Officer Business Support for IT Applications


***Panel interviews are anticipated for July/ August.***
 Purpose
   

  

 You will conduct business analysis to implement and maintain critical software solutions. This role involves providing expertise in business requirements analysis, process analysis, solution design and software configuration to meet the organization's digitalization, technology security, and regulatory needs.
   

  

 Operating Network
   

  

 You will report to the Head of Unit. You will be in working contact with other colleagues in FI and other Directorates for business aspects, while you will co-operate closely with the other units of the FI-PRO Back-Office Divisions and with FI-SDM and GDO on technical aspects. The post will primarily focus on the implementation of Projects falling under the Digital Ambition programme and support the Back Office Divisions for deliveries related to these projects.
   

  

 Regular telework is allowed as long as the Bank’s telework policy and the Minimum Presence Required rules applicable for FI PRO teams are respected.
   

  

 Accountabilities
   

  

**COLLABORATE ON BUSINESS PROJECTS**
 Contribute and provide business support to projects with specific scope and timing to ensure their realization within the set scope, time, and budget.
   

  

* Act as a Business Analyst (under the supervision of the project manager) on complex business or IT projects in the area of Lending and Treasury/Borrowings (e.g. new product implementation, new functionality introduction, new application, Package upgrades, etc.)
* Collaborate in workshops/discussions to understand – within assigned business area – project goals, workflows, complex business needs, gaps, and opportunities
* Review and comment technical documentation related to the approved solution before implementation.
* Report on a regular basis the status of the FI-PRO applications’ developments to the senior colleagues and HoU
* Review the documentation of transactional processes


**PROVIDE SUPPORT AND ENSURE MAINTENANCE AND DEVELOPMENT OF SYSTEMS**
 Support processes related to the implementation and running of the FI-PRO’s applications under the unit’s remit in order to ensure optimum efficiency and reliability of the applications and related financial data and user’s satisfaction (internal and external).
   

  

* Provide 1st level user support: analyse incidents, identify workarounds, provide specific advice and follow-up of resolutions
* Coordinate functional support to business users in FI-PRO directorate
* Gather user requirements for maintenance and developments, follow-up on implementations
* Provide status updates to the senior management on the development
* Execute User Acceptance Tests (UAT) test plans to ensure that business requirements and functional specifications are implemented properly and meet objectives, (e.g. review and definition of rules, reports and activities).
* Collaborate to the training sessions organization when required


**ACT AS CONTACT POINT**
 Build and maintain relationships and collaborate with counterparts from others EIB Group’s Directorates.
   

  

* As needed represent FI-PRO in working groups and transversal initiatives, when related to the applications under unit’s remit.
* Participate and Collaborate to NPCs and working groups that impact FI-PRO on new products or bank-wide initiatives, and assist BuDiS senior colleagues in order to define solutions that will meet the requirements of the services and cover the business needs.
* Streamline the communications with IT and the software vendor for problem resolution.


**Qualifications**
* University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor), ideally in the fields of information technology, mathematics or finance.
* Minimum 3 years of relevant professional experience, ideally in the financial sector, or business consulting companies as Business Analyst or Project Manager.
* Good understanding of payment market standards including the latest ISO 20022 standards.
* Experience with payment and reconciliation software such as ION Wallstreet D&C, SWIFT Alliance Access, Accurate NXG, or similar platforms.
* Good knowledge of financial instruments, systems and processes related to Back-Offices (Borrowings and/or Treasury and/or Lending).
* Knowledge of a financial back-office software (ION Wallstreet TRM - CLM or similar) would be an advantage.
* Experience in IT projects involving business rules automation and IT algorithm implementation, including understanding conditions, loops, and parsing, is an advantage.
* Good presentation and communication skills.
* Good coordination skills.
* Knowledge of the standard computer tools, in particular, strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint is required.
* Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (\*\*) with a good command of the other. Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage.


 Competencies
   

  

*Find out more about EIB core competencies* 
 here
   

  

 To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here
   

  

*(\*\*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of* 
*level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.*
 We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.
   

  

 We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.
   

  

 By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
   

  

 Deadline for applications:
 **10th July 2025**

title: Senior Electronics Engineer
description:
Join Tobii and Shape the Future of Human-Machine Interaction
   

  

 At Tobii, we develop cutting-edge eye tracking technology that transforms the way humans interact with machines. Our innovations power breakthroughs across research, automotive, gaming, and assistive technology.
   

  

 We’re now looking for someone like you—someone who ensures our products don’t just look good on paper but actually works. You’ll be the one who makes sure the electronics are designed right from the start, enabling our products to perform flawlessly in the real world. As the person responsible for all electronics design in our products, you’ll play a key role in turning ideas into reliable, high-impact solutions. Sounds exciting, right?
   

  

**Senior Electronics Engineer at Tobii**
 As a Senior Electronics Engineer at Tobii, you’ll be involved in a variety of tasks across the full product lifecycle. Your work will include development of new products, supporting customer integration projects, and maintaining and improving existing products.
   

  

 When developing new products, you will be part of the entire process, from early concept and prototyping to test fixture design and preparing for mass production, working closely with other disciplines to ensure the final product meets both technical and user needs.
   

  

**What Your Day Might Look Like**
* Circuit design including simulations, component selection and schematic capture
* Layout of high speed and high-density circuitry on space constrained boards
* Lab work including prototyping and hands-on testing
* Ensure compliance with relevant industry standards and regulatory requirement.
* Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues
* Participate in design reviews of both internal and customer implementations
* Contribute to continuous improvement initiatives
* Documenting your work
* Collaborate in cross-functional teams including firmware, mechanical, optronics and system engineering
* Interface with internal and external stakeholders such as production, sourcing, suppliers and customers


****To succeed in this position, we believe that you have:****
* Master in Electronics or similar
* 5 years’ work experience in similar role
* Proficiency in ECAD tools such as Altium Designer, OrCAD or similar
* Comfortable working hands-on in a lab environment
* Great communication skills in English (Swedish is a plus)


 It’s a merit if you also have experience in
   

  

* Altium Designer
* HDI PCB design and/or Flex-PCB design
* Cameras/MIPI CSI, LED drivers, low power design
* Signal integrity and EMC/EMI considerations
* Experience from compliance and pre-compliance
* Familiarity with scripting and/or firmware development
* Jira, Confluence, PDM


**Sounds like you?**
 We’re looking for someone that has a sharp mind and a curious, flexible, and communicative mindset. Being Senior Electronics Engineer, we believe you are proactive, self-driven, and take initiatives. That you communicate clearly and confidently, identify and manage risks effectively, and know how to prioritize your work. You’re a true team player who thrives in collaboration and brings a positive, solution-oriented mindset to the table. In short, you’re someone who gets things done—and brings others along for the ride. You will be part of our mechatronics team of 10+ people. This team is very close and has a great team spirit. We are experts in what we do and have a lot of responsibility but still always take time to help each other out when needed.
   

  

**Did you know this about Tobii?**
 We are the global leader in eye tracking, a position we earned through our passion for technology and our ambition to create tech for a better future. Our journey began more than 20 years ago when we delivered the world’s first remote eye tracker.
