title: Salesforce-administratör
description:
Vill du använda din kompetens inom Salesforce för att göra skillnad? Som Salesforce-administratör hos Läkare Utan Gränser använder du din tekniska kompetens för att stärka världens största medicinska humanitära organisation, och blir samtidigt en nyckelspelare i vår satsning på data-driven insamling och kommunikation.

**Om rollen**  

Du blir den tredje länken i vårt Salesforce team (admin, support, produktägare) och blir central i vårt AI-arbete när du vidareutvecklar integrationsplattformen, samtidigt som du arbetar tätt med IT och webbkollegor. Plattformen är stabil efter en stor migrering, men nu tar vi nästa steg: att förena historisk CRM data med dagens Salesforce-data och att bredda användningen av moduler som Marketing Cloud. Rollen kombinerar operativ support med strategisk utveckling och nära samarbete med en extern partner för kodtunga leveranser.  

  

**Dina främsta arbetsuppgifter**

* Hantera 1st & 2nd line-ärenden för ~40 Salesforce-användare
* Konfigurera fält, layouter, valideringsregler, Flow-automationer och formulär
* Bygga rapporter, dashboards och datamodeller för ökad insikt
* Delta i dataprojekt som samlar äldre CRM-data och ny Salesforce-data
* Kravställa och kvalitetssäkra arbete från extern utvecklingspartner
* Coacha och stötta vår Salesforce-supportkollega

**Vi söker dig som har**

* Minst 3 års erfarenhet som Salesforce-administratör
* Vana vid Scrum eller annan agil metodik
* Goda kunskaper i Flow Builder, rapport-/dashboard-skapande och datamigrering
* Flytande engelska i tal och skrift
* Engagemang för humanitära värden och vilja att göra skillnad med teknik
  

**Det är värdefullt om du har**

* Certifieringar inom Salesforce eller Scrum, erfarenhet av Marketing Cloud eller andra CRM-system
* Tidigare arbete i ideell sektor
* Svenska språkkunskaper
  

**Den sociala arbetsmiljön på Läkare utan Gränser**  

Som medarbetare på Läkare Utan Gränser Sverige kommer du att bidra till att människor får sjukvård och humanitär hjälp. Vi arbetar i en internationell, informell och välkomnande arbetsmiljö. Gemensamt för alla medarbetare är ett starkt engagemang och driv för att nå Läkare Utan Gränsers mål, att lindra nöd och rädda liv där behoven är som störst. Vi är en värderingsstyrd organisation med humanitärt fokus och det påverkar dig oavsett om du är volontär, arbetar på kontoret eller i projekt utomlands. Vi jobbar i team, vilket förutsätter att alla tar sitt ansvar, litar på varandras kompetenser, samt ger och tar emot feedback så att alla kan utvecklas. Vi har en lättsam stämning där ingen är rädd för att hugga i när det behövs. Du ska känna dig respekterad hos oss, oavsett vem du är. Hos oss uppmuntras du till att ta egna initiativ och därmed att utveckla både dig själv och verksamheten. För att kunna lindra nöd och rädda liv är det viktigt med kommunikation, både internt mellan kontoret och våra projekt och externt från oss till omvärlden.

 **Anställningsvillkor**  

Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning (med 6 månaders provanställning)  

Önskat tillträde: Snarast möjligt, med hänsyn till uppsägningstid  

Arbetstid: Vi tillämpar heltid på 37,5-timmarsvecka  

Lön: 36 474 kr/månaden (om du uppfyller kravet på 3 års erfarenhet) Fast lön enligt Läkare Utan Gränsers lönepolicy. Tidigare relevant dokumenterad arbetserfarenhet, utöver kravet för rollen, ger ytterligare påslag(beroende på längd av erfarenhet, upp till max totalt 8 års erfarenhet och 7,5 %)  

Förmåner: Tjänstepension, hälsoförsäkring, livförsäkring, arbetsskadeförsäkring, reseförsäkring, friskvårdsbidrag (upp till 3 000 kr/år) samt en friskvårdstimme i veckan.  

Ingen karensdag samt 100 % ersättning dag 2-14 av sjukdom.  

Semester: 30 dagar/år + 3,5 extra semesterdagar för alla (vilka varierar från år till år)  

Som medarbetare med Läkare Utan Gränser omfattas du av kollektivavtal mellan arbetsgivarorganisationen Fremia och fackförbunden Unionen samt Akademikerförbunden.  

Flexibel arbetspolicy som möjliggör att anställda också delvis kan arbeta hemifrån, men majoriteten av tiden tillbringas på vårt kontor i Årstadal/Liljeholmen.

  

Urval sker löpande, skicka gärna din ansökan redan idag. Sista ansökningsdag är 18 juli men rollen kan komma att tillsättas redan innan sista ansökningsdag. Sök med CV och i stället för att skicka ett personligt brev ber vi dig att svara på frågorna om motivation till Läkare Utan Gränser via vårt rekryteringssystem (vi inte tar emot ansökningar via e-mail enligt GDPR). Läkare Utan Gränser värderar mångfald högt och strävar efter en inkluderande arbetsmiljö. Som arbetsgivare ger vi alla lika möjligheter och vi välkomnar alla kvalificerade ansökningar. Vi uppmuntrar till att ansöka utan foto i ditt CV och endast fokusera på erfarenheter, färdigheter och prestationer relevanta för tjänsten.


Har du frågor är du välkommen att kontakta Ellika Ulltin - ellika.ulltin@lakareutangranser.se (Ants Tech Recrutiers sköter rekryteringen)  

  

Fackliga representant för Unionen är Mia Hejdenberg, mia.hejdenberg@stockholm.msf.org

*Vi ser fram emot att läsa din ansökan!*  

  

*Läkare Utan Gränser/Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF) är en internationell medicinsk humanitär organisation som räddar liv och nöd där vi behövs mest. Vi bistår människor som drabbats av kriser, krig och naturkatastrofer oavsett politisk åsikt, religion eller etnisk tillhörighet. Vårt humanitära arbete styrs av våra grundprinciper; neutrala, opartiska, oberoende och att bära vittnesmål. Läkare Utan Gränser i Sverige är ca hundra medarbetare på kontoret i Liljeholmen i Stockholm som samlar in pengar, rekryterar både utsänd- och kontorspersonal, kommunicerar om det medicinska och humanitära arbetet, bedriver påverkansarbete och stödjer verksamheten runt om i världen.*

title: Konsultchef till Sundsvall eller Umeå
description:
*Implema är en av Sveriges ledande specialister på snabb och effektiv implementering av affärssystem som SAP &* *Microsoft Dynamics. Med över 20 års erfarenhet och 300 medarbetare på 10 kontor runtom i Sverige hjälper vi företag att digitalisera och optimera sina affärsprocesser.*  



Har du ett intresse för ledarskap och en vilja att få människor att växa? Trivs du i kundnära roller och vill bidra till att driva projekt framåt? Då kan detta vara rollen för dig! Implema i Norrland fortsätter att växa och vi söker nu en konsultchef i Sundsvall eller Umeå, som samtidigt vill jobba operativt som projektledare.


Inom SAP-teamet framtidssäkrar vi kunders affärer med SAP-plattformar som S/4HANA, S/4HANA Cloud, CX och Business Technology Platform. Vi söker dig med erfarenhet av personalansvar – eller som naturligt tar ansvar, coachar kollegor och samordnar i teamet. Du har ett genuint engagemang för människor och resultat, bygger förtroende och vill skapa en motiverande arbetsmiljö samtidigt som du utvecklar vårt kunderbjudande.


**Om rollen**
-------------

Som ***konsultchef*** jobbar du med frågor som rör vår viktigaste tillgång - våra medarbetare. Du ansvarar för att ditt team trivs och utvecklas, genom coachande och närvarande ledarskap. Du säkerställer att konsulterna får stöd för att leverera hög kvalitet och bidrar till att bevara Implemas familjära och omhändertagande kultur. Som konsultchef blir du också en del av vårt SAP ledningsteam.


Som ***projektledare*** leder du SAP-projekt från förstudie till driftsättning och stödjer kunder i deras digitaliseringsresa. Du planerar och fördelar arbetet i kundteam, hanterar budget, avtal och uppföljning samt driver förändringsledning för att säkerställa att kunderna tillvaratar investeringarnas fulla värde.


Arbetet fördelas ungefär 50/50 mellan de två rollerna. Rollen som konsultchef kan även kombineras med inslag av Key Account Management för att ytterligare stärka och utveckla våra affärer, beroende på vad som matchar dina tidigare erfarenheter bäst.


**Vi söker dig som**
--------------------

* Har erfarenhet av personalansvar, alternativt ser det som ett naturligt nästa steg i din karriär
* Brinner för att coacha och stötta kollegor samt skapa en positiv och utvecklande arbetsmiljö
* Har erfarenhet av att jobba kundnära och motiveras av att bygga och underhålla starka affärsrelationer
* Har gedigen erfarenhet av projektledning, gärna inom ERP-projekt, samt är van att arbeta enligt etablerade projektmetodiker
* Kommunicerar tydligt och skapar förtroende både internt och externt

Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av SAP och mer specifikt S/4HANA, S/4HANA Cloud, Customer Experience (CX) och Business Technology Platform.


Som person är du samarbetsorienterad och värdesätter att bygga både interna och externa relationer. Du är lösningsfokuserad och ser möjligheter snarare än hinder; när du stöter på problem lyfter du dem konstruktivt med fokus på att hitta hållbara och långsiktiga lösningar. Dessutom tar du ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter och arbetar strukturerat för att säkerställa kvalitet och leverans i tid. Slutligen trivs du i föränderliga miljöer och är snabb på att anpassa dig till nya förutsättningar och utmaningar.


**Vad vi erbjuder?**
--------------------

Vi tror på ett arbetsklimat där kunskap delas, initiativ uppmuntras och varje medarbetare får utvecklas – både professionellt och personligt. Med höga ambitioner och högt i tak skapar vi en miljö där det är lätt att trivas. För oss är det viktigt med work-life-balance, och vi värnar om en trygg arbetsmiljö där du mår bra och känner dig sedd.


##### **Marknadsmässiga villkor och förmåner som stödjer dig**

Utöver konkurrenskraftig lön erbjuder vi en flexibel hybridarbetsmodell, trygga pensions- och försäkringslösningar samt friskvårdsbidrag. Dessutom bjuder vi in på sociala aktiviteter som after work, kickoff och konferensresor

title: SDW/GDW Delivery Lead
description:
What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating a lot of opportunities for people like YOU — people with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to make a difference in this world.


At Cognizant, together with your colleagues from all around the world, you will collaborate on creating solutions for the world's leading companies and help them become more flexible, more innovative and successful. And this is your chance to be part of the success story: we are looking for a Delivery Lead to join our team in Sweden.


**About the team**

Cognizant Sweden boasts a robust team of professionals spread across various cities. Our local team includes experts in AI, data analytics, cloud services, and software development, ensuring we provide top-notch, localized support to our clients. The team is led by a seasoned professional, who brings extensive experience in cloud, AI and analytics and building high performing teams. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us Cognizant.


Cognizant collaborates with all major hyperscale’s and relevant software vendors in the data and AI space. This includes partnerships with industry leaders such as AWS, Microsoft, Google, Snowflake, and Databricks. Our comprehensive approach ensures that we leverage the best tools and technologies to deliver scalable, secure, and efficient solutions. Additionally, we are supported locally by our dedicated Centres of Excellence, which operate both nearshore and offshore. These centres provide specialized expertise and resources, ensuring that we can meet the unique needs of our clients and drive innovation in AI and data cost effectively.


**About the role**

You as a Delivery Lead in the SDW/GDW (Strategic Data Warehouse/Global Data Warehouse) domain will oversee the successful execution of data-related projects, ensuring timely delivery, quality, and alignment with business objectives.


The Team Lead will play a critical role in managing data initiatives, driving cross-functional collaboration, and ensuring high-quality deliverables in data warehousing and ETL solutions.


**Key responsibilities**


* Coordinate cross-functional teams, including developers, designers, testers, and business stakeholders.
* Manage client relationships, acting as the main point of contact for project updates and escalations.
* Track project progress using tools like Jira, Trello, or MS Project, and ensure transparency through regular reporting.
* Ensure resource allocation aligns with project needs and adjust as necessary.
* Facilitate agile ceremonies (e.g., stand-ups, sprint planning, retrospectives) if working in an Agile environment.
* Drive continuous improvement by gathering feedback and implementing process enhancements.
* Ensure compliance with organizational and industry standards, including security and data privacy.
* Support team development, mentoring team members and fostering a collaborative work environment.

**Requirements**


* Data Architecture & Modeling: Understanding of data warehousing concepts, dimensional modeling, and data lake architectures.
* ETL/ELT Processes: Experience designing and managing Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) pipelines using tools like Apache NiFi, Talend, or custom Python/Scala scripts.
* Cloud Platforms: Proficiency in Azure cloud services
* Data Integration: Knowledge of integrating data from various sources including APIs, databases, and third-party platforms.
* Database Management: Strong SQL skills and experience with relational (MSSQL,PostgreSQL, MySQL) and NoSQL databases (MongoDB, Cassandra).
* Data Governance & Quality: Understanding of data lineage, cataloging, quality checks, and compliance (e.g., GDPR).
* Monitoring & Logging: Experience with tools like Prometheus, Grafana, ELK stack, or Datadog for system and data pipeline monitoring.

**What you can expect**


* Become part of a ‘flag ship’ success story - We go through enormous growth!
* Organization driven by technology – We have a tremendous technology backbone
* Environment where you can make your own ideas reality
* Drive your own career
* Market conforms benefits

For more information contact: Cajsa.orvenholt@cognizant.com
company_addresses: 500 Frank W. Burr Boulevard Teaneck, NJ 07666
company_description: Cognizant helps companies modernize technology, reimagine processes and transform experiences so they stay ahead in a fast-changing world.

title: Regional Workday Sales Manager - Nordics
description:
Regional Workday Sales Manager – EMEA  

The purpose of this role is drive and support sales for the Cognizant Workday practice in the Nordics (Norway, Sweden, Finland, Denmark). With understanding, or ability to quickly understand, the competitive landscape in this region. This candidate should be sales competitive by nature and possess a hunger for human interaction. You should also be an exceptional listener and possess a high sense of urgency. Experience in the Workday ecosystem is strongly preferred.


Key Responsibilities  

* Manage deal cycles across all Clients in the region
* Actively update pipeline to ensure management is aware of deal flow
* Maintain a 3X pipeline of deals to quota
* Work with company counterparts to source and execute deals
* Engage with clients, prospects and colleagues to provide services
* Develop/plan your sales strategy and effectively position the Company’s services
* Cultivate relationships with Workday personnel and develop in-person relationships with all in-region field offices
* Develop and Maintain relationships with Workday Account Executives and Business Development Managers
* Drive License sale add-ons for all our partner companies
* Run complex sales cycles managing prospects and internal staff
* Organize and drive responses to RFPs and RFIs
* Set strategy for deal success
* Manage multiple, concurrent deals cycles maintaining accurate and timely client, pipeline, and forecast data
* Manage a quarterly sales quota
* Provide support for marketing activities and events
* Work with the internal Delivery team to develop estimates for work and position us ahead of Collaborative competitors
* Maintain accurate and up to date CRM information
Required Experience
  

* Exceptional presentation skills with the ability to present to all organization levels
* Ability to work with clients and internal team members to estimate services needs
* Ability to understand and effectively communicate the benefits of an on-demand/web services/ cloud multi-tenant architecture
* A successful 5+ year track record, year-over-year, selling software implementation services and or software subscriptions (effective bookings and revenue attainment).
* Professional and/or personal alignment with local Workday employees
* Familiarity with consultative selling methodologies and the ERP Cloud landscape, and Workday in particular (preferred)
* Experience with Excel, Word and PowerPoint as well as using SaaS applications
* Ability to travel up to 50% to client and Workday locations for effective relationship development
* Bachelor’s degree preferred or equivalent work experience

title: BI Lead Engineer
description:
What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating a lot of opportunities for people like YOU — people with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to make a difference in this world.


At Cognizant, together with your colleagues from all around the world, you will collaborate on creating solutions for the world's leading companies and help them become more flexible, more innovative and successful. And this is your chance to be part of the success story: we are looking for a BI Lead Engineer to join our team in Sweden.


**About the team**


Cognizant collaborates with all major hyperscale’s and relevant software vendors in the data and AI space. This includes partnerships with industry leaders such as AWS, Microsoft, Google, Snowflake, and Databricks. Our comprehensive approach ensures that we leverage the best tools and technologies to deliver scalable, secure, and efficient solutions. Additionally, we are supported locally by our dedicated Centres of Excellence, which operate both nearshore and offshore. These centres provide specialized expertise and resources, ensuring that we can meet the unique needs of our clients and drive innovation in AI and data cost effectively.


**About the role**

The Lead Business Intelligence (BI) Engineer is responsible for implementing the strategic design and maintenance of business intelligence and analytical applications. This role drives the long-term data strategy and roadmap, including the selection of technologies and tools. The Lead BI Engineer identifies, researches, and resolves technical problems, ensuring that business intelligence applications enhance and support business decision-making capabilities.


A Lead BI Engineer job description typically highlights a role responsible for leading and mentoring a team of BI developers, designing and implementing BI solutions, and ensuring data integrity and quality. This individual acts as a technical expert, translating business needs into actionable technical requirements, and driving the adoption of modern BI technologies.


**Key responsibilites**

* Lead the end-to-end development of scalable and secure data solutions supporting enterprise-wide BI initiatives.
* Extract, transform, and load data from various sources using SQL and/or data integration tools.
* Oversee the design and implementation of robust ETL/ELT pipelines using tools like Azure Data Factory, SSIS, or Apache Airflow.
* Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand reporting needs and define KPIs.
* Translate business requirements into actionable data models and dashboards.
* Oversee the architecture of data warehouses and reporting systems.
* Enforce data governance and data quality standards.
* Ensure the accuracy, performance, and security of BI platforms.
* Deliver interactive dashboards and reports using tools such as Power BI or Qlik.

**About You**


This position requires a high degree of independence and may involve providing leadership and mentorship to the team. You need to have expertise in BI tools such as POWER BI, Qlik.


**Requirements**

* Strong problem-solving, analytical thinking, and communication skills.
* Experience working with Cloud data platforms (Azure)
* Advanced SQL knowledge for data querying and performance tuning
* Experience with ETL/ELT development using tools like Azure Data Factory, SSIS
* Data modeling (star/snowflake schemas, dimensional modeling)
* Programming/scripting experience in Python, DAX, or R for data transformation and automation
* You have been working with Data warehouse architecture and pipeline design

**Advantage**

* Knowledge of Migration project like Teradata to snowflake.
* Manage data and training pipelines for AI models
* Knowledge of Azure services and Snowflake
* Understanding data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing concepts.

**What you can expect**


* Become part of a ‘flag ship’ success story - We go through enormous growth!
* Organization driven by technology – We have a tremendous technology backbone
* Environment where you can make your own ideas reality
* Drive your own career
* Market conforms benefits

For more information contact: Cajsa.orvenholt@cognizant.com

title: Technical Support
description:
**What we do**


At Helicon, we build digital products that matter. As a digital product development & innovation agency specializing in cleantech, we partner with forward-thinking businesses to build breakthrough digital products, platforms, and capabilities that drive sustainability and efficiency.

**Who we are**


Our journey has taken us from developing one of Sweden’s largest virtual power plants by connecting over 15,000 buildings, to using AI to optimize energy, water, and resource management around the world. We have also helped launch award-winning cleantech startups and SaaS solutions for the energy sector.


But we don’t just measure success by the impact we have on our customers. We measure it by the real-world sustainability gains our solutions create. When our customers tell us that our solutions helped shut down a coal and oil power plant, integrate more renewables into their portfolio, or cut 36,000 tons of CO₂ emissions annually, we take immense pride in that.


What truly drives us is our passion for solving complex challenges together by combining strategy, design, engineering, and data science. At Helicon, speed, curiosity, collaboration, and continuous learning are at the heart of everything we do. If you’re passionate about technology and in using it to make a positive impact on our planet, you’ll fit right in with our team.

**About the role**


You’ll be part of a small but close-knit team of two, where daily work is driven by collaboration, problem-solving, and a strong commitment to helping our field technicians succeed. A significant portion of your day will be spent supporting technicians over the phone during hardware installations. Together, you’ll troubleshoot in real-time to identify whether the issue lies in the hardware, connectivity, installation, or software.


The work can involve anything from network errors and configuration issues to software bugs. You’ll collaborate closely with our development team, making it easy to raise technical questions, report bugs, and suggest improvements. This is a great opportunity to contribute and help enhance the experience for both users and field technicians.

**What you’ll do;**

* Handle incoming calls from technicians and other colleagues
* Troubleshoot and fix IoT device issues
* Support users of the SaaS solution
* Report bugs and system issues (QA)
* Write documentation
* Work closely with developers to resolve/prevent problems

**What you’ll bring to the table;**

* 2+ years of IT support experience
* Basic networking knowledge (DNS, DHCP, LAN, etc.)
* Familiar with AWS or other cloud platforms (e.g., Azure)
* Fluent in English and Swedish
* Familiar with JIRA or a similar ticketing system
* Bonus: Some programming knowledge
* Bonus: Basic Linux/terminal skills
* Bonus: Understanding of how district heating and cooling work

**What we offer**

At Helicon, you can expect to work alongside truly tech-passionate people every day. What we do has a big impact on building a more efficient future, which gives us pride in our work. We foster a culture of humble collaboration, where we are always eager to learn and innovate. We prioritize balance between your job and private life and regularly host social activities like hackathons, after-work gatherings, yearly conferences, shuffleboard comps, and more!

**Application**

Even if you do not meet all the requirements, we encourage you to apply, as our number one priority is to hire the right people instead of nitty-gritty tech.


Our recruitment process usually consists of a first interview, a technical step followed by a business and culture-focused interview.

title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer (MLops and Infra Focus)
description:
We know it, you know it. Most companies ramble on about purpose and making the world a better place. And pretty often it feels a bit… well, forced. But we’d like to think that our story is special for real.


Our founders, Shadi Bitar and Ninos Malki, came to Sweden from Syria when they were kids. Books became their compass, guiding them through the maze of life, and helping them shape their destinies in a new world.


Their dream was bold: What if they could unlock the world of books for everyone, making knowledge and inspiration accessible to all? Fast forward a few years, and the tale of Nextory was born.


At Nextory, we've crafted a revolutionary monthly subscription that empowers our users to devour books like never before, be it through reading or listening. It's not just a product; it's a passport to endless adventure and enlightenment.

 **WHY THIS ROLE MATTERS**


We’re scaling our AI capabilities to help **millions of users** find their next favorite book. To do that, we need someone to help build the infrastructure behind:


**Personalized recommendations**  

**AI librarian**, our multi-agentic book recommender with chat interface  

**Semantic search** with LLMs and vector retrieval


This isn’t just about training models - it’s about designing systems that deliver them **reliably, efficiently and at scale**.

 **WHAT YOU WILL DO**


️ Ship ML-powered features to production with **real user impact**


️ Diagnose and triage issues: analyze logs, core dumps, and diagnostic data to identify root causes and drive timely resolutions.


️ Build and scale ML infrastructure on **Google Cloud Platform** (Vertex AI, BigQuery, GCS)


️ Develop production-quality **Python services** to serve models across chat, search, and recommendation systems


️ Strong experience with **Google Cloud’s Python SDKs**, with a preference for deep familiarity with Vertex AI service


️ Implement **MLOps** practices including model versioning, drift detection, and evaluation tooling


️ Drive **CI/CD**, observability, and automation for ML workflows


️ Ensure model serving is **low-latency**, **scalable**, and **cost-efficient**

 **OUR S****TACK**

**Languages**: Python, SQL

**Cloud & MLOps**: GCP (Vertex AI, BigQuery), Vertex AI Pipelines


**Search & Retrieval**: Vertex AI Search

**Infra & Observability**: Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, GCP Monitoring

 **SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS**

  

️ 5+ years in ML or backend engineering, with 3+ in **production-grade ML infra**


️ Proficient in Python, with experience deploying cloud-native ML systems (preferably GCP + Vertex AI)


️ **Deep experience with end-to-end ML pipelines (training, serving, evaluation) and model serving via REST APIs**


️ Strong command of **Kubernetes**, **CI/CD**, and **infrastructure as code**


️ **Able to mentor engineers, perform code reviews, and drive architectural decisions**


️ **Comfortable with SQL and working with large datasets**

**️** Experience managing **large-scale pipelines** with solid **observability practices**


️ **Strong problem-solving and communication skills; thrives in iterative, fast-paced environments**


️ You’re collaborative, pragmatic, and care about impact more than ego

 **BONUS IF YOU HAVE**

Experience with **Recommendation systems** , **LLM-based features**, or **vector search**

**Hands-on experience with natural language processing (NLU and NLG)**

**Hands-on experience with (multi-)agent systems**


Familiarity with **Vertex AI Search** and **RAG pipelines**


A passion for **metadata tracking**, **model governance**, or **responsible ML**  

  

**WORK ENVIRONMENT AND IMPORTANT DETAILS**


At Nextory, we believe a strong and inclusive culture is key to our success - and that culture flourishes when we meet and collaborate in person as much as possible. That’s why we spend the majority of the working time at our beautiful office!


We are based in Stockholm, Sweden, with offices in Paris and Bangalore. Our hybrid work policy includes four days in the office and Wednesdays as a work-from-home day.


Please note that we do not offer relocation and that a six-month probationary period applies.  

  

If you’re excited to shape the future of how people connect with stories, **COME JOIN US**. Help us bring powerful machine learning to the joy of reading - at scale.

title: Patent Professional
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity**

  

Today, Ericsson owns one of the ICT industry's most valuable portfolio of patents. The global patent portfolio consists of 60,000 granted patents within the areas of cellular technology, consumer electronics, cloud, networks and beyond. Ericsson’s Patent Creation Management is part of the global Ericsson GFGS IPR & Licensing Organization and is responsible for all inventions originating from all Ericsson R&D sites all over the world.

  

We are now expanding our teams in Stockholm and Linköping, and are looking for motivated patent professionals (preferably qualified or partly qualified) looking to contribute to one of the industry’s largest patent portfolios. You will work for a company that is dedicated to research and innovation, leading the development of cellular technology including 5G, 6G and beyond.

 **What you will do**

  

* Provide IPR support for Ericsson’s R&D operations wherein you will work closely with inventors and innovative technology in 3GPP Radio standardisation. In this role you will focus on building a world class patent portfolio related to 6G radio standardisation.
* Handling inventions in all stages from R&D project support, patent application filing and prosecution, and coordination of national filings up to grant in close cooperation with R&D, other patent professionals, and patent offices all over the world.
* Evaluate inventions and take value-based filing and prosecution actions including the drafting of claim charts.
* Participating in key projects supporting licensing and litigation such as business driven claim chart generation and rebuttal and participating in technical discussions.
* Collaborate and communicate with domestic and foreign outside counsel.
* Depending on your qualification and interest you will engage in patent portfolio management, oppositions and/or nullity actions to contribute to the value creation from our patents.
* Engage in working groups and projects to improve operations and strategies.

 **You will bring**

  

* A degree in Engineering, Physics, Computer Sciences, or equivalent providing a strong technical foundation.
* Proven experience in patents such as Patent Attorney Qualification (also partly qualified) or working as a patent examiner or patent engineer & patent portfolio manager in the telecom sector.
* Understanding of telecommunication technologies, in particular radio air interface.
* A keen interest in technical, business and legal matters. Previous experience as an inventor, involvement in standardization, or project management will be an advantage.
* Analytical thinking and an eye for detail, paired with a solution-oriented approach.
* Adaptability in various situations and collaborative teamwork, with skills in coordination and communication.
* Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks and activities as a team member.
* People skills required to work with a diverse group of engineers, patent professionals, and paralegals located around the globe.
* Motivation to learn and improve internal processes and tools.
* AI-based drafting skills are a plus.
* Proficiency in English.
**Application**

  

We look forward to your application with CV in English. We target 60% work-from-the office. Last day to apply is 14th July 2025. Please note that we do not accept, proceed, or respond for applications sent via e-mail. If you have specific questions, you are welcome to contact **Yevgeny Meshulin**, Sr. Talent Partner at yevgeny.meshulin@ericsson.com.


Location: Kista or Linköping, Sweden.
company_description: Do you want to be part of shaping the future? From making connectivity more accessible to the latest IoT solutions, you have an opportunity to be where it begins.
